From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Galician

[edit]

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • descrever (reintegrationist)

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin dēscrībere (“describe”).

Verb

[edit]

describir (first-person singular present describo, first-person singular preterite describín, past participle descrito)

  1. to describe

Conjugation

[edit]

(ti) 		Third-person

Related terms

[edit]
  • descrición
  • descrição

References

[edit]

https://academia.gal/dicionario/-/termo/busca/describir

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin dēscrībere (“describe”).

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /deskɾiˈbiɾ/ [d̪es.kɾiˈβ̞iɾ]
  • Rhymes: -iɾ
  • Syllabification: des‧cri‧bir

Verb

[edit]

describir (first-person singular present describo, first-person singular preterite describí, past participle descrito or (Argentina and Uruguay) descripto)

  1. to describe, represent in words
  2. to trace, describe

Usage notes

[edit]
  • The past participle form descripto is used in Argentina and Uruguay.

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.
3Argentina and Uruguay.
